Dialog.text: Miyu? This is uhm... this is Dr. Calvino.
Miyu. This is Dr. Calvino
I'm feeling ill. Not myself today. I think I won't be in for my shift at all.
Array? I... don't recall-

Dialog.notes: A little dazed sounding. Turns irritable.
Dialog.text: You... must have misunderstood. Eh... are you- honestly I'd prefer it if you left my experiments alone in my absence.
No, no, of course. I remember now. Let's just... for the time being... it doesn't matter.

Dialog.notes: Trying to get off the phone.
Dialog.text: Let's talk about it tomorrow.
You're leaving?
Just turn it off then.
No. I suppose it's late after all. Go. Sleep.
What about me? Don't concern yourself. I'll finish.
You guess.
You're always saying, "I guess." "That worked, I guess. I'll see you later, I guess." You're a scientist. Stop guessing. Know. Or be quiet. That is all.
(Frustrated Grunt)
Che rompi scatole...
Dialog.notes: Grumbling in italian under his breath

Dialog.text: It's running?
Where's the photometer? The handheld. Did you take it?
Yesterday we had two. Now I can't find one.
Nonsense.
Eh... Yes. I was just about to call you.
Yes. That's right. It's the calibration system for the new touchscreen. You only have to run it one time.
The dream. Yes.
Miyu? Miyu - I... I can't move!
I'm in the microgravity lab. Franklin's gone. I don't know what's happening.
Yes! I can't get out. Can you come?
(Sigh) Miyu- ah, no. Wait. I see an Operator. I think it's trying to help me. Ng-
Just follow the dot! When it turns green touch it. It should-
Ahh - well, I suppose you've turned in. Or you're ignoring me.
I just want to... I'll be a little late for my shift tomorrow. But, uh, first thing in the morning I want you to put together a new micro lens array.
You see, the old one is garbage. Get what you need from the machine shop.
And if Clive is being an ass just take it from the supply closet when he's not looking.
We're not supposed to know the code, but I'm sending it to you anyway.
It's uh... it's always in my lab. And... I'm standing in front of the glass.
Nothing. At first. I don't want to turn it on.
But... I can't help it. I have to turn it on. When I do - it's like the heart of a black hole.
An immense... darkness. There's... something... swimming in the black. I catch glimpses. Edges of the shape.
I feel as though it wants to come through... onto my side.
I have to turn off the glass before it sees me but I always wake before I can.
I, uh- nothing.
Dialog.notes: Starts to describe it, but then clams up.

Dialog.text: No. No, no. That's... I don't...
Dialog.notes: It's obvious he's lying. He's shaken by the image Khol showed him.

Dialog.text: Where did you get that drawing? Have you been spying on me?
I don't want to talk to you anymore.
What about the mirrors?
Never. I have never removed a Neuromod... and yet, today I could not find my way to the Hardware Labs.
I wandered the Arboretum for an hour. I made some excuse. But... I know Miyu suspects.
I cannot keep making toys for TranStar when... (deep breath) I told Alex what I want to try.
He gave me a device to help. Parapsychological contraption.
Dialog.notes: Last two words - almost disdain for it. Doesn't quite know what it is.

Dialog.text: Morgan made it. Some of the components are... beyond me.
The same dream again. There is... something wrong with this station. Something here with us... but-
Dialog.notes: Just woke up. Groggy. A little short of breath.

Dialog.text: I am hallucinating now. There is no question.
I... tried to open the locker, but I could not remember our anniversary.
And for a moment, even her name escaped me. Her name!
If one day I wake up and cannot even remember the work I am doing - I must give it all to Morgan.
He will know what to do with it.
She will know what to do with it.
First test. Anterior electrodes overheated after six seconds.
But... I swear - there was a moment... I saw her again. The day we met on the Costa Amalfi. Her lemon sundress. My Clorinda.
Dialog.notes: Shaking from adrenaline. Emphasis on "I saw her". Awe.
